TopicTitle: Platform Enigma- an off topic chat thread.

Articles.Content:
I'm not the right person to explain it, but Wikipedia can!

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doppler_cooling

Surgery cutter beam aren't always the perfect one, You can use wider beam and do larger damage over time.

I see lasers as perfect weapon for taking down incoming missiles, especially on ships where bulk is less essential.

Also You can imagine that overkill lasers can easily (by accident or in purpose) damage objects in orbit :-|.

In my opinion, the better weapon would be using a narrow laser beam to ionize the atmosphere, and then sending a high current through. Do it on both sides of the sensitive electronics and watch unprotected drones crash.

In my opinion, the better weapon would be using a narrow laser beam to ionize the atmosphere, and then sending a high current through. Do it on both sides of the sensitive electronics and watch unprotected drones crash.

That would likely be used if the area is overran as a last resort. Or perhaps as a way to enforce a no-fly zone?

Dudrie Kerman has done something successful!

I never really realized how far Kerbin actually is from Minmus.

Dudrie Kerman has done something successful!

I never really realized how far Kerbin actually is from Minmus.

Next mission! Send him into Kerbol to repay him for his valued service!

Next mission! Send him into Kerbol to repay him for his valued service!
I'm actually going to add more fuel to my nuclear transfer stage (not shown) and combine that with this lander to make a larger lander so I'll be able to return from duna.
